title: 5 Easy Ways to Block Ads on Hulu Forever

steps.title: Install ad-blocking extensions on Google Chrome.
steps.content: Install ad-blocking extensions on Google Chrome. While this method isn't as reliable as upgrading your Hulu subscription, you can try it before paying for an upgrade. Once they are installed, they should block ads automatically. To install a Chrome extension, go to the extension page in the Chrome web store and click Add to Chrome in the upper-right corner. Then click Add extension . The following are some Chrome extensions you can try: Hulu Ad Skipper uBlock Origin Lite Note that many of these extensions are for Chrome web browsers, but since Edge is a Chromium-based browser, you can also install these extensions there. In your Edge browser, go to Settings > Extensions and enable Allow extensions from other stores . Then install the extensions to your Edge browser as if you were using Chrome. You may need to try different ad blockers. Some will remove the ads from Hulu stream, while others will cause your browser to get hung up when Hulu goes to ads.

steps.title: Try watching Hulu in the Brave browser.
steps.content: Try watching Hulu in the Brave browser. Ad-blocking web browsers like Brave block ads to preserve your privacy. Some Hulu users have reported being able to watch Hulu without ads using Brave. To install Brave, head to https://brave.com/download in your current web browser and click Get Brave in the upper-right corner. Once the installer downloads, double-click it and follow the on-screen instructions to install Brave.[[Image:Skip Ads on Hulu Step Once you have Brave, adjust your settings in Settings > Shields > Trackers & ads blocking > Standard/Disabled. If you've changed other settings to make the browser even more strict, you may need to change them again in Privacy & Security . After tweaking your settings, fire up Hulu to watch ad-free.

steps.title: Open Hulu in two separate tabs.
steps.content: Open Hulu in two separate tabs. Go to https://www.hulu.com/hub/home in two separate tabs. This method isn't the easiest and is a little awkward, so use it as one of your last options.

steps.title: Start watching a show on the first tab.
steps.content: Start watching a show on the first tab. Find a show you want to watch and click it to play it.

steps.title: Mute the show.
steps.content: Mute the show. Click the speaker icon in the lower-left corner of the video playback to mute the show. Allow the show to keep playing.

steps.title: Start watching the same show in the second tab.
steps.content: Start watching the same show in the second tab. Watch the show as normal with the volume up until you reach the first ad break. mute that tab or video on Hulu and hop to your first tab, where the ad should have finished playing.

steps.title: Mute the show before the ad break starts.
steps.content: Mute the show before the ad break starts. Just before the ad break starts, click the speaker icon in the lower-left corner to mute the audio.

steps.title: Resume watching your show from the first tab.
steps.content: Resume watching your show from the first tab. Switch back over to the first tab and unmute it. You might need to rewind a little to pick up where you left off, which should be right after the first commercial break, on the second tab.

steps.title: Repeat until you've finished your show.
steps.content: Repeat until you've finished your show. Mute tabs and hop back and forth to avoid watching the ads while you're watching your show on Hulu.

steps.title: Log in to your router's settings online.
steps.content: Log in to your router's settings online. If you want to block Hulu ads on every device in your home, including on your TV, you'll usually need to block Hulu's ad servers on your router. The steps for blocking services on your router will differ depending on your router's manufacturer, but this should give you a general idea of what you need to do.

steps.title: Look for "Web Filtering" or "Advanced."
steps.content: Look for "Web Filtering" or "Advanced." This could be a tab at the top of the page or in the menu along the left side of the page.

steps.title: Enter this domain to block:
steps.content: Enter this domain to block: ads-e-darwin.hulustream.com . [1] X Research source Hulu may prevent you from blocking this address in the future, so this may not be the easiest method. If you add this domain and find that Hulu won't load anymore, repeat this process and remove it from your filter.

steps.title: Go to your account settings at https://www.hulu.com/hub/home.
steps.content: Go to your account settings at https://www.hulu.com/hub/home . The most reliable way to get rid of Hulu ads is to upgrade to Hulu's No Ads plan. Of course, this also means you will have to pay extra. [2] X Research source Although this method shows steps for Hulu on the web, you can also use your Android , iPhone, or iPad .

steps.title: Click your initial or profile image.
steps.content: Click your initial or profile image. and click Account . Your profile image or initial is in the upper-right corner. Hovering over it with a mouse displays a drop-down menu. Click Account in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Manage Plan.
steps.content: Click Manage Plan . You'll see this under the "Your Subscription" header in the middle of the page. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click the switch next to "Hulu (No Ads)" to toggle it on.
steps.content: Click the switch next to "Hulu (No Ads)" to toggle it on. The switch will turn black and point to the right to indicate that it is on. The Review Changes button will also darken and become clickable.

steps.title: Click Review Changes.
steps.content: Click Review Changes . It's the darker button at the bottom of your screen. [4] X Research source You'll be redirected to a page where you can review your subscription changes.

steps.title: Click Submit.
steps.content: Click Submit . After you've looked at what your new bill will cost in the future, click Submit to finalize your plan. You can now enjoy ad-free Hulu.
